course_title: AI Challenges and Ethical Considerations in Urban Mobility
course_description: This course provides a practical introduction to the ethical principles guiding the use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Urban Mobility systems. Participants will explore key dimensions such as human oversight, algorithmic accountability, data governance, and fairness in automated decision-making. Through analysis of institutional guidelines and regulatory frameworks, the course equips learners with the tools to evaluate and guide AI implementations in public and private mobility contexts, ensuring alignment with fundamental rights and European legal standards.
target_audience: Urban planners, transportation engineers, data scientists, policymakers, and professionals interested in applying AI and Machine Learning (ML) to mobility challenges.
